001package io.github.ai4ci.util;
002
003/**
004 * Utility class providing mathematical conversions for probability, rates, and
005 * odds transformations. This class implements conversions commonly used in
006 * epidemiological and statistical modelling.
007 *
008 * <p>
009 * <b>Key Mathematical Relationships:</b> \[ \newcommand{\prob}{p}
010 * \newcommand{\rate}{\lambda} \newcommand{\period}{T} \newcommand{\odds}{o} \]
011 * <ul>
012 * <li><b>Exponential Distribution:</b> Probability from rate: \[ \prob = 1 -
013 * e^{-\rate} \]</li>
014 * <li><b>Logistic Transformation:</b> Logit function: \[ \text{logit}(\prob) =
015 * \ln\left(\frac{\prob}{1-\prob}\right) \]</li>
016 * <li><b>Odds Ratio Scaling:</b> Adjusted probability: \[
017 * \text{logit}(\prob_{\text{adj}}) = \text{logit}(\prob) + \ln(OR) \]</li>
018 * </ul>
019 *
020 * <p>
021 * <b>Domain Constraints:</b>
022 * <ul>
023 * <li>Probabilities must be in range [0, 1]</li>
024 * <li>Rates must be non-negative</li>
025 * <li>Periods must be positive</li>
026 * <li>Odds ratios must be positive finite values</li>
027 * </ul>
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * All methods handle edge cases appropriately, returning appropriate limits for
031 * boundary inputs.
032 *
033 * @see Math#exp(double)
034 * @see Math#log(double)
035 */
036public class Conversions {
037
038        // EXPONENTIAL DISTRIBUTION
039
040        /**
041         * Inverse logistic transformation (expit function). Converts log-odds to
042         * probability. \[ \text{expit}(x) = \frac{1}{1 + e^{-x}} \]
043         *
044         * @param logOdds log-odds value
045         * @return equivalent probability
046         */
047        public static double expit(double logOdds) {
048                if (logOdds == Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY) return 0;
049                if (logOdds == Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY) return 1;
050                return probabilityFromOdds(Math.exp(logOdds));
051        }
052
053        /**
054         * Calculates half-life from probability. Inverse of
055         * {@link #probabilityFromHalfLife(double)}. \[ T_{1/2} =
056         * \frac{\ln(0.5)}{\ln(1-\prob)} \]
057         *
058         * @param p daily probability
059         * @return half-life
060         */
061        public static double halfLifeFromProbability(double p) {
062                return Math.log(0.5) / (Math.log(1 - p));
063        }
064
065        /**
066         * Logistic transformation (logit function). Converts probability to
067         * log-odds. \[ \text{logit}(p) = \ln\left(\frac{p}{1-p}\right) \]
068         *
069         * @param p probability in range (0, 1)
070         * @return log-odds
071         */
072        public static double logit(double p) {
073                if (p == 0) return Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
074                if (p == 1) return Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
075                return Math.log(oddsFromProbability(p));
076        }
077
078        /**
079         * Multiplies two probabilities on the log-odds scale. Equivalent to
080         * independent probability multiplication. \[ \text{logit}(p_1 \cdot p_2) =
081         * \text{logit}(p_1) + \text{logit}(p_2) \]
082         *
083         * @param logOdds1 first log-odds
084         * @param logOdds2 second log-odds
085         * @return combined log-odds
086         */
087        public static double multiplyLogit(double logOdds1, double logOdds2) {
088                return logit(expit(logOdds1) * expit(logOdds2));
089        }
090
091        /**
092         * Converts probability to odds. Inverse of
093         * {@link #probabilityFromOdds(double)}. \[ \odds = \frac{p}{1-p} \]
094         *
095         * @param probability probability value
096         * @return equivalent odds
097         */
098        public static double oddsFromProbability(double probability) {
099                if (probability == 1.0) return Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
100                return probability / (1 - probability);
101        }
102
103        /**
104         * Calculates the odds ratio between two probabilities. \[ OR =
105         * \frac{\odds_1}{\odds_2} = \frac{p_1/(1-p_1)}{p_2/(1-p_2)} \]
106         *
107         * @param p1 first probability
108         * @param p2 second probability
109         * @return odds ratio
110         */
111        public static double oddsRatio(double p1, double p2) {
112                return (p1 / (1 - p1)) / (p2 / (1 - p2));
113        }
114
115        /**
116         * Converts a probability to the equivalent average time period. Inverse of
117         * {@link #probabilityFromPeriod(double)}. \[ \period =
118         * -\frac{1}{\ln(1-\prob)} \]
119         *
120         * @param p probability in range [0, 1)
121         * @return average time period
122         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if probability is 1 (infinite period)
123         */
124        public static double periodFromProbability(double p) {
125                return 1 / rateFromProbability(p);
126        }
127
128        /**
129         * Calculates probability from half-life using the median (50th percentile).
130         * \[ \prob = 1 - \exp\left(-\frac{\ln(2)}{T_{1/2}}\right) \]
131         *
132         * @param halfLife median time to event
133         * @return daily probability
134         */
135        public static double probabilityFromHalfLife(double halfLife) {
136                if (halfLife <= 0) return 0;
137                return probabilityFromQuantile(halfLife, 0.5);
138        }
139
140        // LOGISTIC AND ODDS TRANSFORMATIONS
141
142        /**
143         * Converts odds to probability. \[ p = \frac{\odds}{1 + \odds} \]
144         *
145         * @param odds odds value
146         * @return equivalent probability
147         */
148        public static double probabilityFromOdds(double odds) {
149                if (Double.isInfinite(odds)) return 1.0;
150                return odds / (odds + 1);
151        }
152
153        /**
154         * Converts an average time period to the per-unit-time probability of
155         * transition under an exponential distribution model. \[ \prob = 1 -
156         * e^{-1/\period} \]
157         *
158         * @param period average time to event (must be positive)
159         * @return probability of event occurring in one time unit
160         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if period is negative
161         */
162        public static double probabilityFromPeriod(double period) {
163                if (period <= 0) return 1;
164                return probabilityFromRate(1 / period);
165        }
166
167        /**
168         * Calculates the probability from a specified quantile and period. \[ \prob
169         * = 1 - \exp\left(-\frac{\ln(1-q)}{\period}\right) \]
170         *
171         * @param period   time period
172         * @param quantile probability threshold
173         * @return daily probability
174         */
175        public static double probabilityFromQuantile(
176                        double period, double quantile
177        ) {
178                return probabilityFromRate(rateFromQuantile(period, quantile));
179        }
180
181        /**
182         * Converts a rate parameter to the per-unit-time probability of event
183         * occurrence under an exponential distribution assumption. \[ \prob = 1 -
184         * e^{-\rate} \] Commonly used to convert transmission rates to daily
185         * probabilities.
186         *
187         * @param rate event rate (lambda parameter of exponential distribution)
188         * @return probability of event in one time unit
189         */
190        public static double probabilityFromRate(double rate) {
191                if (rate <= 0) return 0;
192                return 1 - Math.exp(-rate);
193        }
194
195        /**
196         * Converts a probability to the equivalent rate parameter. Inverse of
197         * {@link #probabilityFromRate(double)}. \[ \rate = -\ln(1-\prob) \]
198         *
199         * @param p probability in range [0, 1)
200         * @return equivalent rate parameter
201         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if probability is 1 (infinite rate)
202         */
203        public static double rateFromProbability(double p) {
204                return -Math.log(1 - p);
205        }
206
207        /**
208         * Calculates the rate parameter given a specific quantile of the exponential
209         * distribution. Useful when specifying durations using percentiles rather
210         * than means. \[ \rate = -\frac{\ln(1-q)}{\period} \]
211         *
212         * @param period   time period for the quantile
213         * @param quantile probability threshold (e.g., 0.95 for 95th percentile)
214         * @return rate parameter
215         */
216        public static double rateFromQuantile(double period, double quantile) {
217                if (period <= 0) return Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
218                return -Math.log(1 - quantile) / period;
219        }
220
221        /**
222         * Calculates rate ratio between two probabilities. Simple ratio on
223         * probability scale. \[ RR = \frac{p_1}{p_2} \]
224         *
225         * @param p1 first probability
226         * @param p2 second probability
227         * @return rate ratio
228         */
229        public static double rateRatio(double p1, double p2) {
230                return p1 / p2;
231        }
232
233        /**
234         * Scales a probability by an odds ratio using logistic transformation. \[
235         * p_{\text{adj}} = \text{expit}(\text{logit}(p) + \ln(OR)) \]
236         *
237         * @param p         original probability
238         * @param oddsRatio multiplicative factor
239         * @return adjusted probability
240         */
241        public static double scaleProbabilityByOR(double p, double oddsRatio) {
242                if (oddsRatio == Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY) return 1;
243                if (oddsRatio == 1) return p;
244                if (oddsRatio == 0) return 0;
245                double tmp = expit(logit(p) + Math.log(oddsRatio));
246                return tmp;
247        }
248
249        /**
250         * Scales a probability by a rate ratio (simple multiplication). \[
251         * p_{\text{adj}} = p \cdot RR \] Note: Result may exceed 1.0 if RR > 1/p.
252         *
253         * @param p         original probability
254         * @param rateRatio multiplicative factor
255         * @return scaled probability
256         */
257        public static double scaleProbabilityByRR(double p, double rateRatio) {
258                return p * rateRatio;
259        }
260
261        /**
262         * Scales a rate by an odds ratio using logistic transformation. Applies the
263         * odds ratio on the log-odds scale.
264         *
265         * @param rate      original rate parameter
266         * @param oddsRatio multiplicative factor on odds scale
267         * @return scaled rate
268         */
269        public static double scaleRateByOR(double rate, double oddsRatio) {
270                return rateFromProbability(
271                                scaleProbabilityByOR(probabilityFromRate(rate), oddsRatio)
272                );
273        }
274
275        /**
276         * Applies exponential waning to log-odds over time. Models diminishing
277         * effect with hyperbolic decay. \[ \text{logOdds}_{\text{waned}} =
278         * \text{logOdds} \cdot \frac{x}{x + t} \]
279         *
280         * @param logOdds   original log-odds
281         * @param period    current time period
282         * @param maxPeriod maximum period for full waning
283         * @return waned log-odds
284         */
285        public static double waneLogOdds(
286                        double logOdds, double period, double maxPeriod
287        ) {
288                if ((period < 0) || (period > maxPeriod)) return 0;
289                if (maxPeriod == 0) return logOdds;
290                // scale by x/(x+delay) such that at end point
291                // it is 10% of original value
292                // 0.1 = x / (x + maxPeriod)
293                double x = maxPeriod / 9.0;
294                return logOdds * x / (x + period);
295        }
296}
